sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Netherlands introduce a new lockdown, closing non-essential shops and public places from Sunday as cases of the new variant surge across Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Various countries across Europe start vaccinating children against Covid-19 as the number of cases of the new variant increases.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Environmental activists gather in Belgrade to protest against Rio Tinto's plans to start mining lithium in Serbia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: After massing troops near Ukraine's border, Russia has now made demands of NATO that the West is never likely to agree to.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In a bid to curb the spread of Omicron, the Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte has announced

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: a strict lockdown for the Netherlands over the Christmas period.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The new rules that take effect on Sunday include the closure of non-essential shops, bars, restaurants and public places.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: People are also being urged to stay at home and limit the number of people they meet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Rutte said the restrictions were unavoidable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In the UK, extremely high numbers of the new Omicron variant continue to be reported.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Authorities are concerned about the potential strain on the National Health Service.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Experts expect a huge increase in hospitalisations if new restrictions are not imposed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Mayor of London is taking action.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We're incredibly concerned by the huge surge in the Omicron variant. Hospital admissions are going up, but also staff absences are going up by a massive level.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: So I've taken the decision in consultation with our partners to declare a major incident today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: France also imposed new regulations on travel to and from the UK, prompting long queues and hundreds to leave before the restrictions came into effect.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And in Austria, thousands protested on the streets of Vienna against Covid-19 measures, including mandatory vaccination and the lockdown of those who are not vaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Compulsory vaccination is expected to start in February for all residents over the age of 14.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Various countries across Europe have now made it possible for children to be vaccinated against COVID-19.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In Portugal, one of the countries with the highest vaccination rates in the world, the doors of vaccination centres opened to 5 to 11-year-olds on Saturday morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Queues even started at this centre in the capital at 9am. This mother says that grandparents have already been vaccinated, parents have already been vaccinated, her whole family has. So the only person left was him. That's why they came today and they'll be back for the second dose. In France, children in high-risk categories or living with immunocompromised people have also started to be vaccinated. According to the French health minister, all children should be eligible for vaccination from Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This French physician says that as of today, at this health centre, they've opened 50 slots for children. There will also be 100 slots next week, and then they hope there will be some more, but that depends on vaccine delivery.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And in Denmark, as new Covid restrictions were announced on Friday, like the closing of cinemas, theatres and concert halls, Covid vaccination for children is solidly underway.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This little boy says he's been vaccinated because of the new corona variant. And because he doesn't want to be so sick, he can't eat his dinner.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Covid vaccination of children in Estonia also started on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Thousands have gathered for peaceful demonstrations in the centre of Barcelona. The reason? A court decision that mandates 25 per cent of all school subjects be taught in Spanish.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The region of Catalonia has its own language called Catalan, and the majority of its over 7 million residents speak it and Spanish fluently.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The language of the country, of the Catalan country, is Catalan, not Spanish.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This is a linguistic invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: At home we speak in Catalan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Our grandparents speak in Catalan, families speak in Catalan, and yet children are able to speak Spanish without any problem.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They have access to Spanish via the internet, the TV, friends.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: During Franco's reign, the use of Catalan was prohibited in schools.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Since his death in 1975, there has been a big comeback of the language and it's considered a regional achievement. Many Catalans consider the court ruling an attack on their educational system and their autonomy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Environment activists have protested outside government offices in Belgrade against plans to mine lithium in western Serbia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Mining giant Rio Tinto wants to extract the metal, which is a vital component of laptop and phone batteries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The local council has voted to suspend a development plan that included the mining project after protests across the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Aleksandar Vucic has until Christmas to delete the JDAR project from the spatial plan, to make public all the documents signed by his government and the government before that, going back to 2004, and to terminate any contract with Rio Tinto.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He has only one option and that is to thank Rio Tinto, as all normal countries in the world and in Europe would have done, and to expel Rio Tinto, as all normal countries in the world and in Europe would have done, and to expel Rio Tinto." Prime Minister Vucic has responded by saying more transparency is needed about Rio Tinto's mining plans before they can go ahead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And activists say they'll continue protesting until the mining project is abandoned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russia has now positioned around 100,000 troops near its border with Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The big question is whether President Putin really intends to invade the country again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: He's done it before. In 2014, Russia annexed Crimea in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: On Friday, Moscow made its demands to NATO clear.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The alliance's infrastructure continues to move. It has to be stopped. We need to return to the positions that Russia and NATO held in 1997, when the founding act on our relations was signed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Working for NATO, Belgian warplanes were patrolling Estonia's airspace well before the troop build-up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Even so, the tension is clearly rising.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We have been clear as the United States and just yesterday the 30 nations of the NATO alliance were clear in a statement that came out of the North Atlantic Council.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We're prepared for dialogue with Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We've had dialogue with Russia on European security issues for the last 20 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Lithuania's Foreign Minister says he hopes the West will reject what he called Russia's threats.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: VLADIMIR VOLKHOV, Lithuanian Foreign Minister Lithuania's Foreign Minister One could have guessed that Russia would try, by threatening Ukraine, to demand strategic concessions from NATO and the West in general.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The question is whether to agree to such concessions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I hope that they will be rejected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russia's demanding that no former Soviet state be allowed to join NATO and that the bloc's troops move away from Russia's borders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But analysts say the bloc is very unlikely to agree.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Czech Republic has commemorated the 10th anniversary of the death of Vaclav Havel, the playwright, dissident and first president of post-communist Czechoslovakia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Politicians and famous Czech personalities honored the late statesman by meeting in Slavia Cafe, one of his preferred spots, and laid flowers at a memorial site.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: To mark the 10 years since his death, an exhibition, film screenings, concerts and a parade also took place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: One of Italy's most wanted criminals has been caught and arrested in a small town in Sardinia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Graziano Messina was sentenced to 30 years in jail in 2020 for drug trafficking, but he went missing before he could be incarcerated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In the early hours of Saturday morning, the 79-year-old was found sleeping in a residential building.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He has spent much of his life in jail and is famous for his many prison escapes. Two building cranes in the Italian city of Turin collapsed on Saturday, killing three

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: construction workers and injuring several passers-by. One of the cranes was being used to assemble the other larger crane when the accident occurred. Parts of the metal fell onto a nearby building and road. Investigators are working to find out what. Parts of the metal fell onto a nearby building and road.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Investigators are working to find out what was the cause of the collapse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He was worshipped by the Romans as the god of the weak and a great protector.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And now researchers have uncovered the possible location of the Hercules of Cádiz temple, a building thought lost for centuries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Scientists say they have mapped a large ancient building in the Spanish town of Sancti Petri, believed to be the prized temple.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Archaeologist Milagros Alzaga-Garcia said, The documentary sources we have analysed, the archaeological information, together with the images obtained with digital models of the site, lead us to believe that it could be the mythical temple of Hercules.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The temple was first mentioned in classical Greek and Latin sources, such as Strabo and Philostratus of Athens, which described the building on the dockside as a large Phoenician complex that was accessed by crossing two columns.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And what scientists have discovered so far indicate that they have solved the long-lost archaeological mystery.
